articles.title: Kim Jong Un Inspects Islet Defence Detachment in Western Sector of Front
articles.content:
im Jong Un Inspects Islet Defence Detachment in Western Sector of Front
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, inspected the defence detachment on Mahap Islet in the western sector of the front.
					 Going round the headquarters of the detachment, barracks, education rooms and mess halls of various companies, he had warm talks with their service personnel and paid deep attention to their living. 
					
					 Noting that the soldiers on forefront like those of the detachment should be stronger than anyone in their revolutionary faith, he underlined the need to train the soldiers of the detachment as indomitable fighters steadfast in the spirit of defending the socialist country by conducting the political and ideological education among them in a unique manner.
					
					 He called for providing better cultural living conditions to the soldiers, establishing a strong habit of reading books and learning among them and conducting brisk activities of company art groups so that they may always spend their days of worthwhile military service full of optimism and joy with versatile knowledge and cultural attainments. 
					
					 Learning in detail about the supply service to the soldiers and the education of the children of officers' families, he underlined the need to pay special attention to the living of the service personnel and officers' families and direct efforts to bean farming, greenhouse farming, stockbreeding and sideline fishing so that the service personnel of the islet detachment may not long for the life on the land.
					
					 He mounted an observation post where he learned in detail about the deployment of artillery pieces and combat readiness after being briefed on the firepower strike plan of the detachment.
					
					 Urging the service personnel of the detachment to do their bit once a fight breaks out, he gave precious instructions to round off its combat preparations.
					
					 He issued a surprise order to artillery piece No. 3 of the second platoon of the first company of the detachment to go into action from its position and strike the designated target and guided a live shell firing drill.
					
					 Having promptly finished their preparations to open fire, the artillerymen accurately hit the naval target as ordered by him.
					
					 He highly appreciated the results of their firing, saying with great joy that they are really good at firing as they won the master gunner prize at the artillery firing contest of islet artillery sub-units held in last July and he might rest assured of the defence detachment on Mahap Islet. He had a photo taken with them.
					
					 He gave the soldiers a pair of binoculars, an automatic rifle and a machine gun as gifts and had a photo session with all service personnel and officers' families of the defence detachment.
					
					 Accompanying him were Vice-Marshal of the KPA Hwang Pyong So, director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA, Vice-Marshal of the KPA Ri Myong Su, chief of the General Staff of the KPA, Army Col. General Ri Yong Gil, first vice-chief of the KPA General Staff and director of the General Operation Bureau, Army Major General Pak Jong Chon, director of the Artillery Bureau of the KPA, Army Lieut. General Ri Song Guk, commander of the 4th Corps of the KPA, and Army Major General Ri Yong Chol, political commissar of the corps.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Reply Messages to Foreign Party and State Leaders
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Reply Messages to Foreign Party and State Leaders
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un sent messages to foreign party and state leaders in his reply to their messages of greeting on the 71st anniversary of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 Among them were the president of Laos who is general secretary of the C.C., the Lao People's Revolutionary Party, the president of Syria and the chairman of the Executive Committee of the Palestine Liberation Organization who is president of Palestine.
					
					 The reply messages expressed deep thanks to them for their sincere congratulations and best wishes on the 71st anniversary of the founding of the WPK.
					
					 The messages expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and the relevant countries would grow stronger and wished them successes in their work.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Angolan President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Angolan President
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Friday sent a message of greeting to Jose Eduardo Dos Santos, president of the Republic of Angola, on the 41st anniversary of its independence.
					 The message sincerely wished the friendly government and people of Angola bigger successes in the work for national unity, progress and prosperity under the guidance of the president, reiterating the will to boost the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries in various fields.

articles.title: Exhibition of Achievements of Women's Union Opens
articles.content:
Exhibition of Achievements of Women's Union Opens
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- An exhibition of achievements made by the women's union marking the Sixth Congress of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea opened with due ceremony at the People's Palace of Culture on Friday.
					 Displayed there are achievements made by the women's union organizations at all levels including the C.C., the women's union and its provincial committees in strengthening the women's union and building a rich and powerful country since the Fifth Congress of the women's union.
					
					 Present at the ceremony were Ri Il Hwan, department director of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Jong Sun, chairwoman of the C.C., the women's union, and officials and members of the women's union.
					
					 At the end of the ceremony the participants went round the exhibition.

articles.title: Exhibition of Consumer Goods Opens
articles.content:
Exhibition of Consumer Goods Opens
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- There opened an exhibition of consumer goods of the women's union members to mark the 6th Congress of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea.
					 On show in the venue of the exhibition were more than 50,000 pieces of consumer goods of 1,590 varieties including grass work and daily necessities produced by housewives' work teams with locally available materials and by-products.
					
					 An opening ceremony was held at the new technology innovation hall of the Three-Revolution Exhibition House on Nov. 11.
					
					 It was attended by Choe Ryong Hae, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Jo Yong Chol, minister of Food and Consumer Goods Industries, Kim Jong Sun, chairwoman of the Central Committee of the women's union, and officials and members of the women's union.

articles.title: Agreement on Establishing Friendly Ties between Kim Il Sung University and University of El-Djezair No. 1 Inked
articles.content:
Agreement on Establishing Friendly Ties between Kim Il Sung University and University of El-Djezair No. 1 Inked
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- An agreement on establishing the friendly ties between Kim Il Sung University and the University of El-Djezair No. 1 was inked in Algeria on Nov. 7.
					 Present at the signing-ceremony from the DPRK side were Choe Hyok Chol, DPRK ambassador to Algeria, and members of his embassy and from the Algerian side the president of the University of El-Djezair No. 1 and university officials concerned.
					
					 Choe and the president of the university signed the agreement.

articles.title: Delegation of Korean Democratic Women's Union in Japan Arrives
articles.content:
Delegation of Korean Democratic Women's Union in Japan Arrives
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Korean Democratic Women's Union in Japan headed by Nam Ju Hyon, vice-chairperson of its Central Standing Committee, arrived here Friday to take part in the 6th Congress of the  Democratic Women's Union of Korea.

articles.title: Home-visiting Group of Koreans in Japan Here
articles.content:
Home-visiting Group of Koreans in Japan Here
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- A home-visiting group of Koreans in Japan led by Sin Jong Su arrived here Friday.

articles.title: Delegation of Women Officials of General Association of Koreans in China Arrives
articles.content:
Delegation of Women Officials of General Association of Koreans in China Arrives
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- A delegation of women officials of the General Association of Koreans in China headed by Ri Sun Nam, chairperson of the Federation of Korean National Economic Workers in China, arrived here Friday to participate in the 6th Congress of the  Democratic Women's Union of Korea.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Korean Democratic Women's Union in Japan due to participate in the Sixth Congress of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea and a home-visiting group of Koreans in Japan visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Friday.
					 Members of the delegation and the group laid bunches of flowers before the statues of the great leaders and paid homage to them.

articles.title: New Software for Education of Children Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
New Software for Education of Children Developed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- A software for the education of children, called "Sinbigyong", was developed in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 The software deals with details about one hundred living animals, and it can be used in smart phone and tablet computer.
					
					 It is high in visual and aural effects to impress users as being in the world of animals.
					
					 This software has been already introduced to various educational institutions including Kyongsang Kindergarten in Pyongyang.
					
					 The newly-developed software "Sinbigyong" won a high appraisal at the recent National Exhibition of IT Successes 2016.

articles.title: Results of 13th People's Games in DPRK
articles.content:
Results of 13th People's Games in DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- The 13th People's Games of the DPRK came to a close some days ago, leaving deep impressions on the experts and sports fans.
					 The games took place, divided into two groups--the sports teams and the amateur teams.
					
					 In the group of sports teams, competitions were made in more than 30 events for 400-odd gold medals.
					
					 The Kigwancha team came first in the men's football event and the April 25 team in the women's football.
					
					 The Suyangsan Sports Team took the first and second places in the catch-weight event of Ssirum (Korean wrestling).
					
					 What caught the eyes of spectators were records of new athletes.
					
					 A teen-ager of the April 25 Sports Team won gold medals in the women's 800 meter and 1,500 meter freestyle swimming and a 12-year-old girl of the Taesongsan Sports Team snatched a bronze medal in the women's individual figure skating.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Naegohyang team comprising mainly of teenagers came third in the women's football event.
					
					 The 13th People's Games well showed the rapid sports development of the country.

articles.title: Kimchi Making Brisk in DPRK
articles.content:
Kimchi Making Brisk in DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- Now is the kimchi-making season in the DPRK, where various vehicles carrying vegetables can be seen in streets and villages.
					 It has been a tradition of Koreans to make kimchi at homes in every November, regarding it as an important affair of a year.
					
					 In recent years, vegetable greenhouses were built in different parts of the country and a new change was also witnessed in the way of making kimchi.
					
					 Kimchi-making contest and show are often held to disseminate the relevant knowledge and technique to citizens.
					
					 The Korean nation's custom of making kimchi was registered as a world intangible cultural heritage at the 10th Session of the Intergovernmental Committee for the Safeguarding of the Intangible Cultural Heritage of the UNESCO last year.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Assails U.S. Moves to Step up Deployment of THAAD in South Korea
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Assails U.S. Moves to Step up Deployment of THAAD in South Korea
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- The U.S. is putting spurs to the moves for deploying THAAD despite the scandal-ridden political climate in south Korea.
					 Against the backdrop of the ceaseless disclosure of evidence of the scandal called "Choe Sun Sil Gate" that has driven traitor Park Geun Hye to a pretty fix, high-ranking officials of the U.S. Departments of State and Defense are noisily trumpeting about the projected THAAD deployment in south Korea.
					
					 The U.S. assistant secretary of State for East Asia-Pacific affairs was reported to have said at a press interview in Washington on Nov. 3 that "U.S.-south Korea alliance would remain strong as has been for 60 odd years despite any political climate in Seoul" and "there would be no change in the major priority tasks of the alliance including the projected deployment of THAAD."
					
					 The commander of the U.S. forces in south Korea reaffirmed at a lecture in Seoul on Nov. 4 the earlier deployment of THAAD though it had been scheduled for late 2017, asserting "the U.S. is strongly willing to push ahead with the deployment of THAAD in south Korea and it is expected to be deployed in 8 to 10 months to come." He openly blustered the scale of THAAD to be deployed in south Korea would be bigger than the one on Guam.
					
					 This reveals the greedy nature of the Yankee "gentlemen" persistently seeking their strategic interests only even at a time when their hand-raised Park's regime is on the verge of collapse.
					
					 For the U.S., traitor Park is no more than a dog-like colonial slave fawning upon her master to prolong her remaining days.
					
					 The U.S., being indifferent to the plight of Park who is more dead than alive after being forsaken by the people and to the chaos of the south Korean society, seeks to deploy THAAD earlier at any cost by pressurizing her regime and thus turn south Korea into a hotbed of nuclear war. 
					
					 THAAD deployment is part of the foolhardy arms buildup of the U.S. to secure absolute military edge over major big powers.
					
					 The U.S. concedes that it cannot hold political and military hegemony in the region unless it sets up a perfect MD system and modernizes its forces to be strong enough to neutralize the attack capability of the rapidly developing regional powers.
					
					 The projected THAAD deployment is a risky move to invite a new Cold War in Asia-Pacific as it will upset the strategic balance in the region, directly containing China and Russia by force of arms.
					
					 An arms race and a new Cold War are looming in Asia-Pacific with the projected THAAD deployment as a momentum.
					
					 That's why the countries around the Korean peninsula are exerting efforts to bolster their military capability to cope with the deployment of THAAD, keeping high vigilance against it with growing concern.
					
					 No wonder, China and Russia have opted for an all-out offensive to halt the deployment, contending that THAAD would seriously upset the strategic equilibrium in the region and disturb their strategic security and interests.
					
					 U.S. politicians had better drop their anachronistic wild ambition for dominating the world, though belatedly, if they are far-sighted.

articles.title: Principle of Independence against Imperialism and Principle of Socialism Are Guaranteed by Arms: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Principle of Independence against Imperialism and Principle of Socialism Are Guaranteed by Arms: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- The principle of independence against imperialism and the principle of socialism are guaranteed by strong arms, says Rodong Sinmun Friday in an article.
					 The imperialists facing ruin are resorting to high-handed and arbitrary practices in all parts of the world to destroy the cause of human independence and the socialist cause, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 But the Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK government are now dynamically advancing the revolution along the road of victory despite any storm and stress while firmly maintaining the principle of independence against imperialism and the principle of socialism under the grim situation.
					
					 The Korean people have ruthlessly shattered the ever-increasing nuclear threat and blackmail and aggression moves by the imperialists and their followers by dint of the powerful military muscle.
					
					 The disaster of war is unceasing in different parts of the world and the people of various countries are groping for a way of living. But there has been no gun report in the DPRK for decades and the Korean people are enjoying a peaceful and stable life without a war though their life is not abundant. This is entirely the fruition of the Songun politics.
					
					 As the Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK government have consistently adhered to the principle of independence against imperialism and the principle of socialism, the DPRK, a country of small territory and population, could strengthen the political and military might in every way and honorably defend global peace and security by resolutely shattering the unprecedented moves of the U.S.-led imperialist allied forces to invade and stifle it.
					
					 History has made not a few records about the tragic destiny met by countries and nations which failed to build their strength, obsessed with disillusion about imperialism, only to regret later after being reduced to colonial slaves.
					
					 The DPRK enjoys high prestige in the international arena as the bulwark of socialism, fortress of independence against imperialism and the mouthpiece of justice and truth because it has constantly and firmly adhered to the principle of independence against imperialism and the principle of socialism.

articles.title: U.S. Persistent War Moves Will Bring Ruin: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
U.S. Persistent War Moves Will Bring Ruin: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- It was reported that a magazine dealing with cartoon satirizing the crimes of the U.S. which imposed nuclear disaster on mankind are being sold in Arab countries.
					 The cartoon depicts a boy with his eyes wide open on the lap of his father asking him "which terrorist organization committed such an atrocity?" when watching a picture in which a nuclear bomb explodes in Hiroshima.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday in a commentary says in this regard:
					
					 The cartoon fully revealed that the U.S. is, indeed, the kingpin of terrorism and heinous criminal that makes no scruple of killing the innocent people with WMDs.
					
					 There is a motive of the production of the cartoon in the Arab world.
					
					 Shortly ago, U.S. Congress led by the Republican Party, pretending that the U.S. is the "biggest victim" of international terrorism, passed a bill allowing the victims of the Sept. 11 incident and their families to file a reparation suit with the U.S. court against the government or officials of Saudi Arabia. It claimed that 15 out of 19 terrorists involved in the incident are Saudi Arabians and they might have been supported by the Saudi Arabian government.
					
					 The cartoon is an answer to the U.S. outrageous behavior, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 A cartoon predicts the poor future of the U.S.
					
					 The whole world is cursing and condemning the U.S. for resorting to state-sponsored terrorism and war of aggression and ridiculing the foolish act of the U.S. chief executive trying to cover up them with mask of "victim" and "justice".
					
					 If the U.S. persists in the moves for war, not coming to its senses, it will stand isolation and face ruin.

articles.title: U.S., S. Korean Puppet Warmongers Stage North-targeted War Drills
articles.content:
U.S., S. Korean Puppet Warmongers Stage North-targeted War Drills
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and the south Korean puppet warmongers are hell-bent on war drills targeting the DPRK across south Korea.
					 The Hoguk drill started on Oct. 31 and has reached a grave stage.
					
					 On Nov. 8 helicopters of the U.S. imperialists, helicopters of the Aerial Operation Command of the puppet ground force and the 30th assault battalion committed a drill for infiltrating special warfare forces deep into the inland areas of the DPRK.
					
					 A drill for landing in the coastal areas of the DPRK side was perpetrated at the stage of "decisive action" in Phohang, North Kyongsang Province on Nov. 2.
					
					 The puppet 20th motorized infantry division staged a drill for getting familiar with the procedures to create attack condition, firing live shells in coordinated operation with the air force.
					
					 On the sidelines of the Hoguk drill, the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces and the south Korean puppet air force were keen on the joint aerial drill under the signboard of "matchless shield" at the U.S. Air Force base in Osan from Nov. 4 with the air force of UK involved for the first time in history.
					
					 The warmongers entered a full-dress drill from Nov. 8.
					
					 Fighters, air refueling tankers and strategic transport planes were mobilized in a precision strike at military facilities of the opposite side, the command in particular.
					
					 Meanwhile, the puppet Sixth Corps announced that it would stage an anti-infiltration drill with civilian and administration officials and the police in the northern areas of Kyonggi Province from Nov. 7 to 11.

articles.title: Park Geun Hye's Moves for Procrastination Rejected
articles.content:
Park Geun Hye's Moves for Procrastination Rejected
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- According to reports from Seoul, south Korean opposition parties and civic and public organizations rejected traitor Park Geun Hye's remarks that she would accept the prime minister recommended by the "National Assembly" on Nov. 8.
					 The representative of the Minju Party condemned it as the one aimed to deceive the people once again.
					
					 What the people demand is that the "president" should take her hands off state affairs.
					
					 The chairman of the emergency measure committee of the Kukmin Party said the agreement at the NA touted by Park is the one for procrastination.
					
					 The former co-representative of the Kukmin Party termed Park's remarks an expression of her will to lead state affairs.
					
					 The mayor of Songnam City held a press conference and said the "president" should step down and if not, she should go through procedures on impeachment.
					
					 The Headquarters for 2016 People's All-out Action said Park's "proposal" is nothing but a move to seek an opportunity.
					
					 Meanwhile, representatives of the Minju Party, the Kukmin Party and the Jongui Party met at the NA on Nov. 9 at which they agreed to make joint counteraction to the emergency situation.
					
					 They agreed to channel all forces of all parties to taking an active part in the Nov. 12 people's all-out action and join the people in their actions.

articles.title: Musicians and Sports Persons of S. Korea Demand Ousting of Park Geun Hye
articles.content:
Musicians and Sports Persons of S. Korea Demand Ousting of Park Geun Hye
Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- 2,300 odd musicians of south Korea released a critique on Nov. 8 in demand of ouster of Park Guen Hye for her scandal.
					 The critique said the one regarding the people as dogs and pigs should be ousted, adding artistes of south Korea will turn out in the struggle to oust Park Gune Hye in order to change their life.
					
					 Earlier, civic and social bodies related to sports including the Sports Citizens Solidarity and the Sports Culture Institute released a critique on Nov. 7.
					
					 It disclosed that all scandals of Chongwadae were committed through the Ministry of Culture, Sport and Tourism.
					
					 It urged Park to undergo a special investigation and withdraw herself from administration.

articles.title: S. Koreans Demand Resignation of Park Geun Hye
articles.content:
S. Koreans Demand Resignation of Park Geun Hye
Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- The Ulsan Citizens Action for Ousting Park Geun Hye involving people of various circles in Ulsan area held a press conference outside the Ulsan City Office on Nov. 8 demanding the resignation of Park.
					 Saying even students enraged by Park's scandal are taking to streets demanding Park's resignation but Park and her group seem to be indifferent to the public indignation, speakers called for ousting Park.
					
					 A press release termed the state of the south Korean society an emergency caused by scandals of Park and Choe Sun Sil, demanding Park resign immediately as she has neither capacity nor qualification to be "president" of south Korea.
					
					 Now is just the time to retrieve democracy and people's living and protect peace, it added.
					
					 It called for making an unlimited investigation into Park and others involved in the scandals and sternly punishing them.

articles.title: Overwhelming Majority of S. Korean Respondents Demand Park Geun Hye's Resignation
articles.content:
Overwhelming Majority of S. Korean Respondents Demand Park Geun Hye's Resignation
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- Public opinions demanding the resignation of traitor Park Geun Hye are growing stronger in south Korea day by day, according to a report from Seoul on Nov. 10.
					 The results of opinion poll conducted by a survey institution over the blame put on the chief executive for the monopolization of administration from Nov. 7 to 9 among more than 1,550 adult men and women across south Korea showed that over 60 percent of the respondents demanded the "president's" resignation.
					
					 78.8 percent of the respondents demanded the "president" take her hands off state affairs.

articles.title: Organized Actions Staged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Organized Actions Staged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- Organized actions urging Park Geun Hye to step down from office are being staged in different parts of south Korea on the eve of the people's all-out action scheduled on Nov. 12, according to reports.
					 More than 60 trade unions organizations of part-time workers launched campaigns of making public the declaration on the situation in Seoul on Nov. 8 demanding the Park Geun Hye regime step down and the bill on labor reform abolished.
					
					 Professors in Ryongnam University and Seoul Municipal University urged Park Geun Hye to step down and demanded the reshuffle of the cabinet.
					
					 13 civic and public organizations, officials concerned of political parties in Kangrung, south Kangwon Province and organizations of different social standings unanimously cried out for the step-down of the Park regime through the campaigns of making public declarations on the situation.
					
					 144 dancers' organizations across south Korea called for bringing down Park Geun Hye and probing the truth behind the scandal of the administration monopolization through the declaration on the situation.
					
					 On Nov. 9, the committee for the promotion of the young people's all-out action issued a declaration on the situation in Seoul demanding Park Geun Hye step down.
					
					 27 students' organizations of departments and postgraduate course of Sogang University in the declaration on the situation urged the university to strip Park of the honorary doctorate degree at once.
					
					 The Peace and Justice Commission of the Catholic Suwon Parish in a statement on the situation said that the only way out for the "president" to make a sincere apology to the people is to step down from office at once and to face punishment.
					
					 Voices for the step-down of Park Geun Hye from office are also being heard at city offices of Pusan and Inchon, the education office in Taegu City, the North and South Chungchong Provincial offices and administration organs.
					
					 Small and medium-sized merchants launched protest actions in different parts of south Korea in denunciation of the puppet authorities.
					
					 On the evening of Nov. 9, more than 10,000 citizens held a candlelight rally in the area of Kwanghwamun in Seoul and held demonstration march through Jongro and Uljiro.
					
					 Employees of the public transport trade union under the Confederation of Trade Unions held a meeting for general strike in Kwanghwamun and joined the citizens in the candlelight action.
					
					 On Nov. 9, more than 1,500 civic and public organizations of south Korea including the 2016 Headquarters for People's All-out Action and the Solidarity Council of Civic and Public Organizations held a press conference and declared that the people's emergency action to bring down Park Geun Hye from office was formed.
					
					 The Inchon Citizens Emergency Action is working hard to form the large march group to take part in the all-people meeting due in Seoul on Nov. 12.
					
					 The Kimpho joint conference of civic and public organizations said it would conduct a candlelight rally and demonstration in streets, timed to coincide with the all-people meeting in Seoul.

articles.title: S. Korean Public Demands Punishment of Park Geun Hye under Criminal Law
articles.content:
S. Korean Public Demands Punishment of Park Geun Hye under Criminal Law
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- The south Korean public is getting increasingly vocal demanding that Park Geun Hye not only be investigated for being a chief culprit in the scandal but impeached to face punishment under the criminal law.
					 The south Korean society of professors of the law colleges conducted an emergency opinion poll among the professors of law across south Korea from Nov. 4 to 8 and 75 per cent of the respondents demanded the impeachment of Park. 
					
					 On Nov. 9 a conservative association and lawmakers from the "Saenuri Party" held an emergency seminar on the situation at "the National Assembly."

articles.title: S. Korean Writer Slams Conservative Forces' Scandal
articles.content:
S. Korean Writer Slams Conservative Forces' Scandal
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- A poem written by Hwang Yu Gwan, director of the Writers Association of south Korea, was posted on a south Korean on-line paper on Nov. 7. 
					 The poem assailed the authorities' policy of mistreating the people, deploring that the society is riddled with so serious corruption that such undesirable forces as ruling political party and heavyweights behind scene are plundering the workers and peasants of what they have earned at the cost of sweat and blood by employing various methods.

articles.title: S. Korean Personage Slams Park Geun Hye's Misrule
articles.content:
S. Korean Personage Slams Park Geun Hye's Misrule
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Won Ung, chairman of the Federation of Organizations of Participants in the Anti-Japanese Independence Movement of south Korea, wrote in an article posted on the south Korean internet paper Voice of Seoul on Nov. 8 that the people never entrusted Park Geun Hye with any responsibility and "presidency." 
					 She wrested "presidency" through the worst power-backed fraudulent election, the article said.
					
					 It queried is it possible for south Korea to retract the plan for deploying THAAD and repeal the humiliating "agreement" on the issue of sexual slavery with Park Geun Hye staying in power.

articles.title: "Saenuri Party" Has No Qualifications to Talk about Measures for Putting Situation under Control
articles.content:
"Saenuri Party" Has No Qualifications to Talk about Measures for Putting Situation under Control
Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- Thrown into a pretty fix by a hideous political scandal of traitor Park Geun Hye, the gentries of the "Saenuri Party" of south Korea are busy seeking a way out.
					 They are raking their brains to seek a U turn in the phase, raising a hue and cry over "thorough investigation into the case and severe punishment", "formation of a neutral cabinet", etc. 
					
					 They are asserting investigation of Park and her "withdrawal from the party", claiming they have nothing to do with this case and never knew Choe Sun Sil. 
					
					 This is nothing but a brazen-faced and crafty artifice to evade the responsibility for this serious situation and weather the worst crisis by calming down the angry public.
					
					 It is another ridiculous political caricature for the "Saenuri Party" to talk about measures for putting the present chaos under control from the position of a judge, not the accused, as it is chiefly to blame for orchestrating the unprecedented political scandal. 
					
					 It is none other than the "Saenuri Party" which was involved as an accomplice in the political scandal because Choe Sun Sil, no more than a witch, had controlled Park like a puppet, thus mocking the south Korean political circles.
					
					 It was quite long before that the issue of Choe was raised in the south Korean political camp.
					
					 But the "Saenuri Party" has played the role of a guard and shield of Chongwadae, overlooking and abetting the arbitrary practices of Park and Choe.
					
					 It closed its eyes to Choe frequenting Chongwadae as she pleased as a main player though she held no official post.
					
					 It was the "Saenuri Party" that insisted on protecting Choe's daughter calling her "promising player" during inspection of the administration with regard to her in April, 2014 after Park took office.
					
					 It also glossed over the case of Jong Yun Hoe, ex-husband of Choe, in which he intervened in state affairs, stunning the south Korean society.
					
					 When there were suspicions about Choe's involvement in Mir Foundation and K Sports Foundation, the upper crust of the party including its representative took the lead in shielding Park's scandal.
					
					 Ri Jong Hyon, representative of the "Saenuri Party", attempted to paint the public criticism of the suspected scandals as a partisan strife between the ruling party and opposition parties even through fasting. Lawmakers from the ruling party prevented Choe Sun Sil and Cha Un Thaek who are chiefly to blame for the case from appearing at the inspection of administration as witnesses. 
					
					 This group of conspirers is playing a poor trick to pull the wool over the public, far from reflecting on their crimes. This is only touching off extreme disillusion and repugnancy.
					
					 Even Jon Ryo Ok and Kim Mu Song, ex-representative of the party, both called "spokespersons of Park", termed the assertion made by gentries of the "Saenuri Party" that "they did not know the existence of Choe Sun Sil" a sheer lie when referring to their mean behavior.
					
					 Such opposition parties as the Minju Party, the Kukmin Party and the Jongui Party have become vocal saying: The "Saenuri Party" should be brought to justice as a ruling party, partners in administering state affairs and accomplice in Park Geun Hye-Choe Sun Sil Gate. Is it qualified to talk about bringing this catastrophic situation under control? Park is chiefly to blame for the worst violation of the constitution and Park and the "Saenuri Party" should be held accountable for the situation which backed her, not just Choe.
					
					 The civic and social bodies of  all strata are denouncing the "Saenuri Party's" proposal for forming "a neutral cabinet" as a plot and intrigue to stay in power and seek a way out and demanding the party kneel down and make an apology before the masses and disband itself at once. 
					
					 The "Saenuri Party" would be well advised to properly reflect on its crimes, though belatedly, as it has followed a witch policy in south Korea, shocking the world.

articles.title: S. Korean Online Paper Calls for Escalating Candlelight Actions against Park Geun Hye
articles.content:
S. Korean Online Paper Calls for Escalating Candlelight Actions against Park Geun Hye
Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- The south Korean online paper OhmyNews in an article on Nov. 8 recalled that Park Geun Hye, when meeting with the speaker of the "National Assembly," just uttered that she would appoint the person nominated by the NA as prime minister and left it ten minutes later. It accused her of repeating her way of putting forward something one by one when she is forced to make a step back.
					 There is only one way to force her to give up the administration, the article said, adding that the candlelight actions should be escalated.

articles.title: S. Korean Media Persons Blast Reptile Media for "Defending Regime"
articles.content:
S. Korean Media Persons Blast Reptile Media for "Defending Regime"
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Kyunghyang Daily News said on Nov. 9 that media persons are becoming increasingly vocal protesting against the misinformation spread by broadcasting services.
					 The south Korean media trade union on Nov. 9 held an emergency seminar on the subject of "Park Geun Hye's Breach of Constitution and Public Broadcasting Service".
					
					 The participants denounced MBC for deleting the words critical of the tough attitude of U Pyong U from the story filed by a reporter.
					
					 They censured some broadcasting services for airing twisted programs aimed at defending the persistent attitude of the regime. 
					
					 They called for struggling for impartial reporting amid the people's attention.

articles.title: National Seminar on Juche Idea Takes Place in Guinea
articles.content:
National Seminar on Juche Idea Takes Place in Guinea
Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- A national seminar on the Juche idea took place in Conakry on the theme of "The role of the youth in building independent Africa on the occasion of the 58th anniversary of independence of the Republic of Guinea" on Nov. 4.
					Present at the seminar were figures of the organizations for the study of the Juche idea such as the Guinean National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism and masses, the DPRK ambassador to Guinea and members of his embassy and a delegation of the Social Scientists Society of Korea on a visit to African countries.
					
					A reporter and speakers lauded supreme leader Kim Jong Un for formulating the Juche idea founded by President Kim Il Sung and developed in depth by leader Kim Jong Il as Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism and leading the revolution and construction by regarding it as the guidelines.
					
					Saying that it is a very vital problem to settle the issue of the youth in view of the history and experience of the struggle for independence of Africa, they stressed that only when they advance under the banner of the great Juche idea, the most advanced and scientific political theory, the broad popular masses including the youth can achieve the genuine independence and progress.
					
					They expressed their determinations to make positive contributions to building independent and prosperous Africa by actively following the experience gained by the DPRK which perfectly settled the issue of the youth.
					
					A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the seminar.

articles.title: Congratulatory Message to Kim Jong Un from Participants in Guinean National Seminar on Juche Idea
articles.content:
Congratulatory Message to Kim Jong Un from Participants in Guinean National Seminar on Juche Idea
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a congratulatory message from the participants in the national seminar on the Juche idea on the theme of "The role of the youth in building independent Africa on the occasion of the 58th anniversary of independence of the Republic of Guinea" on Nov. 4.
					 The message said that we, members of the Guinean National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism and adherents of the Juche idea, came to gain value experience from the great victories won by the heroic Korean people in building an independent socialist power under the banner of Songun under the bright rays of the Juche idea founded by President Kim Il Sung and developed in depth by leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 We also came to fully realize once again that Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism is the guiding idea helping the African people reject the threat of "globalization" and consolidate independence and sovereignty, the message noted.
					
					 We are convinced that the DPRK became a great dignified country in the international arena and will become an invincible power which will further prosper thanks to Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, it pointed out.
					
					 For us, it is a very important matter at present to accept the essence of the great philosophical idea as ours and realize the unity and development of Africa, it said.
					
					 It extended warm congratulations to HE Kim Jong Un who made great contributions to defending the gains of the Juche revolution made under the banner of Songun.
					
					 It sincerely wished Kim Jong Un good health and the Korean people brilliant victories under his wise guidance.
					
					 It also extended full solidarity to the heroic Korean People's Army and Korean people that are struggling to provide a peaceful climate on the Korean peninsula and reunify the country.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Bulgaria
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Bulgaria
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- A committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed in Bulgaria on Nov. 3.
					 The chief of the Kim Il Sung Library in Sofia was elected chairwoman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize political and cultural events such as a remembrance meeting and film show on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of demise of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un inspecciona unidad de defensa de isla Mahap del frente occidental
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un inspecciona unidad de defensa de isla Mahap del frente occidental
Pyongyang, 11 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Kim Jong Un, Presidente del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y del Comite de Estado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, inspecciono la unidad de defensa de la isla de Mahap, situada en el frente occidental.
					Al ver al Comandante Supremo quien visito inesperadamente a su puesto, los militares por los preparativos de combate le dieron las aclamaciones "!Viva!".
					
					Kim Jong Un recorrio la comandancia de la unidad, el cuartel, las salas de educacion y los comedores de varias companias, y departio con los militares atendiendo a la vida de estos.
					
					El Comandante Supremo dijo que los militares del frente avanzado como los de esa unidad que se enfrentan directamente con los enemigos, deben poseer la firma conviccion revolucionaria y destaco la necesidad de organizar vividamente la educacion ideo-politica para formar a los uniformados como los combatientes indoblegables armados con el firme espiritu de defensa a la patria socialista.
					
					Hay que ofrecer a los militares las suficientes condiciones de vida cultural y establecer el ambiente de lectura y estudio, asi como dinamizar las actividades del grupo artistico de la compania, para que los militares de la unidad posean ricos conocimientos y abundantes preparaciones culturales y pasen los dias alegres de servicio militar lleno de optimismo y jubilo, recalco.
					
					Tras conocer en detalles varios asuntos como el estado de abastecimiento para los militares y el problema de educacion para los hijos de los familiares de los oficiales, subrayo la necesidad de prestar la especial atencion a la vida de los militares y los familiares de los puestos militares islenos, prestar atencion al cultivo de soya, la agricultura en invernadero y la ganaderia junto con la pesca, de modo que los uniformados islenos no envidien nada a la vida de la tierra.
					
					El Comandante Supremo subio al puesto de vigilancia, donde escucho el parte sobre el plan de golpe de fuego artillero y averiguo en detalles el estado de colocacion de los canones y de los preparativos de combate.
					
					Si estalla la guerra, los militares de la unidad deben cumplir satisfactoriamente con su mision, apunto y dio las instrucciones preciosas para el perfeccionamiento de los preparativos de combate de la unidad.
					
					El mismo dia, el Comandante Supremo dio al canon No.3 de segundo peloton de la primera compania de la unidad la orden inesperado de mover el canon de su trinchera ocupada y golpear el blanco indicado y dirigio el entrenamiento de tiro.
					
					Terminados con rapidez los preparativos de tiro, los artilleros acertaron el blanco maritimo, cumpliendo la orden del Comandante Supremo.
					
					Al decir con alegria que son tiradores certeros los artilleros de la unidad quienes lograron el premio de artillero certero en la competencia de tiro de canon efectuado en julio pasado, evaluo altamente los resultados de tiro y se fotografio junto a ellos.
					
					Kim Jong Un dio como recuerdo a los uniformados los binoculos, el fusil automatico y la ametralladora y se fotografio junto con todos los militares y los familiares de los oficiales de la unidad.
					
					Le acompanaron el vicemariscal del EPC Hwang Pyong So, jefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC, el vicemariscal del EPC Ri Myong Su, jefe del Estado Mayor General del EPC, el coronel general de las fuerzas terrestres Ri Yong Gil, primer subjefe y director general de Operaciones del EMG del EPC, el general de brigada de las fuerzas terrestres Pak Jong Chon, director de Artilleria del EPC, el teniente general de las fuerzas terrestres Ri Song Guk, jefe de 4o cuerpo de ejercito del EPC, y el general de brigada de las fuerzas terrestres Ri Yong Chol, comisario politico del cuerpo de ejercito.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia mensajes de respuesta a jefes de partido y Estado de varios paises
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia mensajes de respuesta a jefes de partido y Estado de varios paises 
Pyongyang, 11 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El Presidente Kim Jong Un envio mensajes de respuesta a los jefes de partido y Estado de varios paises quienes le hicieron llegar misivas para felicitar el aniversario 71 de la fundacion del Partido del Trabajo de Corea. 
					Entre los destinatarios figuran el presidente de la Republica Democratica Popular Lao y secretario general del Comite Central del Partido Popular Revolucionario Lao, el presidente de la Republica Arabe de Siria y el presidente del Estado de Palestina y del comite ejecutivo de la Organizacion de Liberacion Palestina. 
					
					En las correspondencias, Kim Jong Un les expreso profundo agradecimiento por haberle enviado sinceras felicitaciones con motivo de la efemeride coreana.
					
					Convencido de que seguiran fortaleciendose y desarrollandose tambien en el futuro las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre la RPDC y los respectivos paises, formulo votos por los exitos en las responsabilidades de destinatarios.

articles.title: Inaugurada exposicion de exitos de la UMDC
articles.content:
Inaugurada exposicion de exitos de la UMDC 
Pyongyang, 11 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Quedo iniciada la exposicion de exitos de las labores de la Union de Mujeres Democraticas de Corea con motivo del VI Congreso de esta organizacion femenina. 
					Alli estaban expuestos de diferentes formas los datos que muestran los exitos alcanzados despues del V Congreso por el Comite Central y los comites provinciales y las organizaciones a todos los niveles de la UMDC en aras de fortalecimiento de sus filas y construccion de potencia prospera. 
					
					La ceremonia de inauguracion tuvo lugar el dia 11 en el Palacio Cultural del Pueblo con la participacion del jefe de departamento del CC del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Ri Il Hwan, la presidenta del Comite Central de la UMDC, Kim Jong Sun, las funcionarias e integrantes de la UMDC. 
					
					Terminada la ceremonia, los participantes recorrieron la exposicion.

articles.title: Firmado acuerdo de establecimiento de relaciones de amistad entre universidades
articles.content:
Firmado acuerdo de establecimiento de relaciones de amistad entre universidades
Pyongyang, 11 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Quedo rubricado el dia 7 en Argelia el acuerdo sobre el establecimiento de relaciones de amistad entre la Universidad Kim Il Sung y la Universidad No.1 de El-Djezair.
					En la ceremonia de firmas tomaron parte el embajador Choe Hyok Chol y otros integrantes de la embajada coreana en Argelia, por la parte coreana, y por la argelina, el presidente y otros funcionarios de la Universidad No.1 de El-Djezair. 
					
					El embajador y el presidente suscribieron el documento.

articles.title: Inaugurada exhibicion de articulos de consumo popular
articles.content:
Inaugurada exhibicion de articulos de consumo popular
Pyongyang, 11 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Quedo inaugurada la exhibicion de articulos de consumo popular de las miembros de la Union de Mujeres Democraticas de Corea dedicada al VI Congreso de esta organizacion femenina.
					En la ocasion fueron exhibidos mas de 50 mil articulos de mil 590 variedades como articulos de paja y miscelaneos de uso diario, fabricados por las organizaciones y miembros de la UMDC de todo el pais a traves de la operacion de los equipos de trabajo de amas de casa y con materias primas y residuales, abundantes en las localidades.
					
					La ceremonia inaugural tuvo lugar el dia 11 en el pabellon de nueva innovacion tecnica de la Exposicion Permanente de las Tres Revoluciones.
					
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes el vicepresidente del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Choe Ryong Hae, el ministro de Industria Alimentaria y de Articulos de Uso Diario, Jo Yong Chol, la presidenta del CC de la UMDC, Kim Jong Sun, y las funcionarias y miembros de la UMDC.
